CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 24, 1953, pg. 6 reads: "Johnson Beauty, Barber Supplies- Johnson's Beauty Store and Beauty Salon, 7131 Frankstown Avenue, is one of the finest establishments of its kind in this area. The Johnson Enterprises have the distinction of bringing the best to their clientele.  Johnson's deals with manufacturers of merit and long standing, namely, Wingate, Gladdeen, Fearance, Virgies, Proctor and Gamble, Howell Brothers, Drake Company "Perulan," Quaker Hair Goods Company, featuring colored dolls; Posner's, Dandercide, M. and W. Manufacturing Company, and many others.  These goods can be purchased at the store or by route service. Johnson's covers from Johnstown, Pa., East, to Erie, Pa., in Northwest...Exterior photo of the Johnson establishment, and its rolling stock with Alphonso Johnson, proprietor, on the right and salesman Wescott White, on the left."
TitMainTitle: Salesman Wescott White and proprietor Alphonso Johnson, standing outside of Johnson's Beauty and Barber Supplies, 7131 Frankstown Avenue, Homewood Brushton
